title: Markus Kröger annouced as keynote speaker at the VII International Congress on Risks
content: Markus Kröger annouced as keynote speaker at the VII International Congress on Risks albov@helsinki.fi Mon, 26/01/2026 - 12:02 The conference will take place from 26 to 29 of May 2026, at the Faculty of Arts and Humanities of the University of Coimbra in Portugal. Project PI for the University of Helsinki, Markus Kröger, has been announced as a key note speaker for the VII International Congress on Risks, Natural Resources, Energy, and Society: Global Risks and Pathways to Sustainability.  ...

title: Markus Kröger interview by the CEIS20 Podcast
content: Markus Kröger interview by the CEIS20 Podcast albov@helsinki.fi Mon, 26/01/2026 - 10:01 Markus was interviewed by the CEIS20 Podcast during a research visit to the Centre for Interdisciplinary Studies (CEIS20) at the University of Coimbra in Portugual. Markus Kröger, one of the PIs of the TreesForDev project, joined João Luís Fernandes, an integrated researcher at the Centre, for a short interview on the CEIS20 Podcast. Markus was visiting CEIS20 within the scope of the Axes of Interdisciplinary...

title: Coworking Days Return to Helsinki Education Hub This Spring
content: Coworking Days Return to Helsinki Education Hub This Spring tiffapog@helsinki.fi Thu, 22/01/2026 - 15:35 Helsinki Education Hub (HEH) is pleased to welcome back our monthly Coworking Days this spring, offering a shared space where edtech founders, researchers, and students can work side by side. Our aim is to bring together people working at the intersection of educational science and edtech development. title: Helsingin yliopiston sijoitustuotto kuusi prosenttia vuonna 2025
content: University of Helsinki investment return six percent in 2025 ksalmiva@helsinki.fi Thu, 22/01/2026 - 15:14 The investments have returned more than 400 million Euros since 2019 University of Helsinki’s financial security investments returned 6.0 percent in 2025. Since the beginning of 2019, when the University adopted the current strategy, the investments have returned cumulatively 116.9 percent, or approximately 440 million Euros. The average annual return has been 11.7 percent, which is 2.0 perc...

title: Helsingin yliopiston kasvatustieteet 41. THE Rankingissa
content: Educational sciences at the University of Helsinki 41st in THE World University Rankings taalto@helsinki.fi Thu, 22/01/2026 - 17:06 The educational sciences improved their ranking from 50 to 41 in the discipline-specific annual Times Higher Education (THE) World University Rankings. This marked rise is a very positive change after years of decline, bringing back educational sciences at the University of Helsinki to the global top 50.
